attributes.action: Make it illegal for politicians to make false promises to voters in elections.
attributes.additional_details:
A politicians promised policies should be treated as a verbal contract.The law says verbal agreements and oral contracts are generally valid and legally binding as long as they are reasonable, equitable, conscionable and made in good faith.
If a politician makes a promise then it should be treated as a verbal agreement. 
Reasonable exceptions such as a banking crisis should be allowed but only within set guidelines.
My aim is to stop politicians knowingly telling lies in order to gain power.
attributes.background: During election campaigns the electorate is routinely lied to by politicians for the sole purpose of winning an election. People listen to a candidates pitch which promises certain policies. They then vote for that person based upon those promised policies. Once elected promises are often broken.
